description: Enterprise-wide control that ensures all access to; and activity involving; protected health information (PHI) and electronic PHI (ePHI) is logged; retained; protected; and available for investigation and compliance review; includes centralized log collection; Security Information and Event Management (SIEM); immutable storage; and role-based log access.
primary_objective: Provide a complete; reliable audit trail of PHI/ePHI access and system activity to support detection; investigation; and regulatory compliance
threats_mitigated: Unauthorized access to PHI; insider misuse; credential compromise; undetected security incidents; configuration tampering
data_categories_protected: Clinical data; demographic data; financial/billing data; authentication logs; administrative data
systems_in_scope: EHR systems; clinical applications; billing systems; identity and access management systems; databases; network devices; security tools
processes_in_scope: User login/logout; PHI view/update/delete; export/print events; admin changes; security configuration changes; policy changes; incident response actions
implementation_guidance: Implement centralized log collection; configure verbose application and database logging; integrate all sources with SIEM; enforce log retention and integrity controls; restrict log access; periodically test log search and reporting capabilities.
monitoring_mechanisms: Continuous SIEM monitoring; real-time alerts for suspicious activity; daily automated reports; weekly manual log review; quarterly audit of logging completeness

description: Control that enforces strong encryption for all PHI/ePHI at rest and in transit across databases; storage systems; backups; archives; and communication channels; includes encryption algorithm standards; key management; key rotation; and decryption access controls.
primary_objective: Ensure confidentiality of PHI/ePHI by rendering data unreadable to unauthorized parties in the event of loss; theft; or unauthorized access
threats_mitigated: Database compromise; storage media theft; backup loss; network interception; cloud provider compromise
data_categories_protected: Clinical records; lab results; imaging data; billing records; identifiers; authentication secrets
systems_in_scope: EHR databases; data warehouses; reporting databases; backup systems; archive systems; secure file stores; integration platforms
processes_in_scope: Data-at-rest encryption; data-in-transit encryption; database export and backup processes; restore and recovery processes
implementation_guidance: Enable Transparent Data Encryption (TDE); configure AES-256 or stronger algorithms; enforce TLS 1.2+ for all connections; centralize key management in HSM/KMS; implement scheduled key rotation; test encryption and decryption procedures regularly.
monitoring_mechanisms: Encryption status dashboards; periodic encryption compliance reports; key usage and access logs; certificate expiration alerts; quarterly encryption verification tests

description: Control that operationalizes the breach notification workflow from detection through risk assessment; determination of reportable breach; individual and media notification; and regulatory reporting; ensures timelines; responsibilities; approvals; and documentation are consistently followed.
primary_objective: Ensure timely; consistent; and compliant notification to individuals; regulators; and media when a breach of unsecured PHI occurs
threats_mitigated: Delayed breach reporting; incomplete notifications; regulatory non-compliance; inadequate documentation; failure to notify media for large breaches
data_categories_protected: Unsecured PHI across all data categories involved in breaches
systems_in_scope: All systems and processes that may detect or report potential breaches; incident response tools; case management systems; communication platforms
processes_in_scope: Breach intake and triage; risk assessment; determination of reportable breach; drafting and approval of notices; delivery of notices; regulatory filings; post-incident review.
implementation_guidance: Deploy standardized breach workflow in case management system; define roles and SLAs; maintain notification templates; integrate with incident detection tools; require legal and compliance review of determinations; track every step and timestamp for audit.
monitoring_mechanisms: Breach metrics dashboards; SLA tracking reports; periodic review of breach cases; internal audits of sample breach files; OCR readiness assessments

description: Control that enforces role-based access control; least privilege; and multi-factor authentication across all systems containing PHI/ePHI; ensures that users only have access necessary for their job functions; with appropriate approvals; periodic reviews; and rapid revocation.
primary_objective: Prevent unauthorized or excessive access to PHI/ePHI by enforcing least privilege and strong authentication
threats_mitigated: Unauthorized access; privilege escalation; inappropriate snooping; orphaned accounts; shared credentials
data_categories_protected: Clinical records; financial data; demographic data; audit logs
systems_in_scope: EHR applications; billing and revenue cycle systems; identity and access management; VPN; remote access; administrative portals
processes_in_scope: User provisioning and deprovisioning; access request workflows; MFA enrollment; periodic access recertification; emergency break-glass access.
implementation_guidance: Implement IAM platform; define roles and entitlements; configure MFA for all users; automate joiner-mover-leaver processes; schedule quarterly access reviews; integrate with HR for terminations; enforce session timeouts and account lockouts.
monitoring_mechanisms: Access violation alerts; quarterly access review reports; privileged access monitoring; orphan account reports; IAM audit logs

description: Control that enforces encryption and integrity protection for all PHI/ePHI transmitted over networks; including email; file transfer; APIs; remote access; telehealth; messaging; and voice/video; requires use of approved secure channels and tools.
primary_objective: Prevent interception; alteration; or unauthorized disclosure of PHI/ePHI during electronic transmission
threats_mitigated: Network sniffing; man-in-the-middle attacks; insecure email; misdirected messages; insecure telehealth sessions
data_categories_protected: Any PHI transmitted over networks; including clinical; billing; demographic; and imaging data
systems_in_scope: Email systems; file transfer platforms; API gateways; VPN; telehealth platforms; messaging tools; collaboration platforms
processes_in_scope: Sending PHI via email; sharing PHI files; remote access to systems; telehealth visits; secure fax; secure messaging between clinicians.
implementation_guidance: Configure secure email gateway with enforced TLS; deploy secure messaging and file transfer platforms; require VPN for remote access; enforce TLS 1.2+ on all web services; configure telehealth platforms for end-to-end encryption; block insecure channels for PHI.
monitoring_mechanisms: Network security monitoring; TLS and certificate compliance checks; email encryption reports; VPN usage reports; telehealth session logs

control_name: Workforce Privacy and Security Training Control
description: Control that mandates and tracks completion of privacy; security; and HITECH-specific training for all workforce members and relevant third parties; including onboarding; annual refreshers; and role-based deep dives for high-risk roles.
primary_objective: Build and maintain a security and privacy-aware culture to reduce human error and increase incident detection and reporting
threats_mitigated: Phishing success; mishandling of PHI; improper disclosures; delayed incident reporting; weak passwords
data_categories_protected: All PHI/ePHI handled by workforce; including clinical; administrative; and financial data
systems_in_scope: Learning management systems; HR systems; identity and access management; email; collaboration platforms
processes_in_scope: New hire onboarding; annual refresher training; role-based security training; just-in-time training; post-incident retraining.
implementation_guidance: Deploy LMS courses; require completion within defined timeframes; integrate with HR for onboarding; implement periodic knowledge checks; track completion and escalate non-compliance; tailor content by role.
monitoring_mechanisms: Training completion dashboards; quiz scores; phishing simulation results; incident trends correlated with training; audit samples of training records

description: Control that operationalizes privacy principles such as minimum necessary; purpose limitation; consent and authorization; patient rights processing; and restrictions on use and disclosure of PHI; includes workflows; forms; checks; and system configurations.
primary_objective: Ensure PHI is collected; used; and disclosed only as permitted and that patient rights are honored
threats_mitigated: Over-collection of PHI; improper disclosures; unauthorized secondary use; failure to honor access or amendment requests
data_categories_protected: All PHI; including clinical; demographic; financial; and sensitive categories like mental health; HIV; substance use
systems_in_scope: EHR; release of information systems; customer service portals; patient portals; research systems; marketing tools
processes_in_scope: Processing patient access requests; amendments; accounting of disclosures; restriction requests; consent and authorization capture; marketing approvals.
implementation_guidance: Configure systems to support minimum necessary views; build privacy request workflows; implement approval steps for sensitive disclosures; maintain templates and forms; track and audit privacy decisions.
monitoring_mechanisms: Privacy metrics; request turnaround time reports; disclosure logs; periodic privacy audits; complaint trends

description: Control that governs detection; triage; investigation; containment; eradication; recovery; and post-incident review for security events; including playbooks; roles; escalation paths; and testing.
primary_objective: Ensure security incidents are detected quickly and handled in a consistent; effective; and compliant manner
threats_mitigated: Undetected intrusions; prolonged outages; uncontrolled malware spread; incomplete recovery; repeat incidents
data_categories_protected: Any PHI/ePHI potentially impacted by incidents; including all systems and data stores
systems_in_scope: Monitoring tools; ticketing/case systems; collaboration tools; backup and recovery systems; disaster recovery sites
processes_in_scope: Incident detection and alerting; triage and classification; investigation; containment; eradication; recovery; lessons learned workshops.
implementation_guidance: Maintain incident response runbooks; define on-call rotations; integrate SIEM alerts with ticketing; run regular tabletop and technical exercises; tie incident closure to documented lessons learned.
monitoring_mechanisms: Incident dashboards; mean-time-to-detect and mean-time-to-recover metrics; incident post-mortem reports; test exercise reports

description: Control that ensures all vendors and third parties with access to PHI/ePHI are identified; risk-assessed; governed by Business Associate Agreements (BAAs); and monitored for ongoing compliance; includes due diligence; contract clauses; and periodic reviews.
primary_objective: Reduce third-party risk by ensuring business associates protect PHI/ePHI at least to the same standard as the covered entity
threats_mitigated: Vendor breaches; subcontractor misuse; inadequate vendor safeguards; lack of contractual protection
data_categories_protected: Any PHI shared with or accessible to vendors; including hosting; billing; transcription; analytics; cloud storage
systems_in_scope: Procurement systems; contract management tools; vendor risk management platforms; security questionnaires
processes_in_scope: Vendor identification and classification; due diligence; BAA negotiation and execution; ongoing security reviews; breach notification coordination; contract termination and data destruction.
implementation_guidance: Standardize BAAs; embed security review in procurement; maintain vendor inventory and risk ratings; schedule periodic reassessments; require notification and cooperation during incidents.
monitoring_mechanisms: Vendor risk dashboards; BAA status reports; vendor assessment results; incident reports involving vendors
